intro: Dyschoriste pinetorum, commonly known as the pine forest dyschoris, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its erect, slender stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale green to yellowish in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and lesser-known species within its native range.
